org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy

Interface ProxyReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ProxyReader>, NameableConfigurable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObservableReader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalReader, AbstractObservableReader, AbstractSelectionLocalReader, AbstractStaticReader, AbstractThreadedLocalReader

    public interface ProxyReader
extends NameableConfigurable, java.lang.Comparable<ProxyReader>
    ProxyReader interface
    • To operate the transmission of SeRequestSet, a specific local reader processes the sorted list of SeRequest.
    • According to SeRequest protocolFlag and to the current status of the reader (RF protocol involved / current ATR) the processing of a specific SeRequest could be skipped.
    • When processing a SeRequest
    • if necessary a new logical channel is open (for a specific AID if defined)
    • and ApduRequest are transmited one by one
    Interface each ReaderPlugin should implement

    • Method Detail

      • isSePresent

        boolean isSePresent()
             throws NoStackTraceThrowable
        Checks if is SE present.
        Returns:
        true if a Secure Element is present in the reader
        Throws:
        NoStackTraceThrowable - a exception without stack trace in order to be catched and processed silently

      • transmit

        SeResponseSet transmit(SeRequestSet seApplicationRequest)
                throws KeypleReaderException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Transmits a SeRequestSet (list of SeRequest) to a SE application and get back the corresponding SeResponseSet (list of SeResponse).

        The usage of this method is conditioned to the presence of a SE in the selected reader.

        All the SeRequest are processed consecutively. The received SeResponse and placed in the SeResponseSet.

        If the protocol flag set in the request match the current SE protocol and the keepChannelOpen flag is set to true, the transmit method returns immediately with a SeResponseSet. This response contains the received response from the matching SE in the last position of set. The previous one are set to null, the logical channel is open.

        If the protocol flag set in the request match the current SE protocol and the keepChannelOpen flag is set to false, the transmission go on for the next SeRequest. The channel is left closed.

        This method could also fail in case of IO error or wrong card state → some reader’s exception (SE missing, IO error, wrong card state, timeout) have to be caught during the processing of the SE request transmission.

        Parameters:
        seApplicationRequest - the application request
        Returns:
        the SE response
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - An error occurs during transmit (channel, IO)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • transmit

        SeResponse transmit(SeRequest seApplicationRequest)
             throws KeypleReaderException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Transmits a single SeRequest (list of ApduRequest) and get back the corresponding SeResponse

        The usage of this method is conditioned to the presence of a SE in the selected reader.

        The SeRequest is processed and the received SeResponse is returned.

        The logical channel is set according to the keepChannelOpen flag.

        This method could also fail in case of IO error or wrong card state → some reader’s exception (SE missing, IO error, wrong card state, timeout) have to be caught during the processing of the SE request transmission. *

        Parameters:
        seApplicationRequest - the SeRequest to transmit
        Returns:
        SeResponse the response to the SeRequest
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - in case of a reader exception
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a bad argument is provided

        void addSeProtocolSetting(SeProtocolSetting seProtocolSetting)
